title: Game-Based STEAM Language Integrated Education Design: Strengthening Creative Problem-Solving and Intercultural Communication Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental language skills (reading, writing, speaking), basic STEAM concept understanding, and digital tool utilization experience
context.additional_context: Emphasizes game design capabilities utilizing cross-cultural mathematical approaches and linguistic communication strategies. Focuses on assessing learners' text analysis, creative expression, and multilingual contextual application skills

learning_goals: Learners enhance creative problem-solving skills and linguistic expression by applying STEAM thinking to game-based activities
Learners develop games integrating vocabulary/grammar elements with STEAM content through cross-cultural comparative analysis

In 3-member team-based game design projects, learners use collaboration tools (Notion, Trello, etc.) to finalize game storyboards (including dialogue/text) within two weeks and create digital prototypes with basic interactivity (demonstration video and language explanations) using Unity or Unreal Engine
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
